alert.note: Alert for Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:26PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso County through 515 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Carson, or 11 miles south of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 5 mph. This has the potential to conglomerate together and create a heavy rain situation that needs to be monitored. Enhanced streamflows over the Fountain Creek and drainages associated with the Fountain Creek are possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... southern Colorado Springs, Fort Carson, Fountain, Security-Widefield, Security and Stratmoor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
